attributes.action: Postage Cost Increases are detrimental to the UK Economy
attributes.additional_details:
The April rise in postage costs, with, international shipping in particular in mind, are detrimental to small businesses in the UK.

With rises ranging from 18.7% to 88.4% Ofcom's effective deregulation of any pricing structure by which Royal Mail is to adhere, whilst maintaining its USO, is nothing short of giving up and admitting that it can not regulate a business that to date can not regulate itself.

It is we, the British public, who are now carrying the cost of their mis-management. This is bad for Britain, bad for the economy, and ultimately will result in the collapse of Royal Mail
